name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course will examine different text types and acquaint students with the techniques and methodologies available in translating these texts. Attention will not only be given to usage, but also to issues of discourse. This course is intended to prepare students for more specialized translation training.
schedule:
Week 1　　Introduction 
Week 2　　N/A
Week 3    (1) different text types and translation/(2) discourse analysis and translator
Week 4　　audio-visual translation (I)
Week 5     audio-visual translation (II) 
Week 6     translation of journalistic texts (I)
Week 7　　N/A
Week 8     translation of journalsitic texts (II)/ translation and technical texts (I)
Week 9　　group translation projects
Week 10   translation of scientific and technical texts (II)
Week 11   translation of advertising texts (I)
Week 12　　translation of advertising texts (II)
Week 13   translation of tourism texts (I)
Week 14   group translation projects
Week 15   N/A
Week 16   translation of tourism texts (II)/ translation of commercial texts
Week 17　　translation of legal texts
Week 18　　Final exam
scorePolicy:
1. attendance & participation: 15%
2. group translation projects: 24 %
3. translation assignments: 30%
4. a group presentation: 10%
5. final-exam: 25%
materials:
1. instructor’s lecture handouts
2. Thinking Chinese Translation (Valerie Pellatt and Eric T. Liu)
